markers.title: Addressing the Loss of Dwelling Rooms
markers.description: Creating new policies to address the loss of dwelling rooms and help for displaced tenants due to redevelopment.

markers.title: Allen District Plan
markers.description: Develop this district as a mixed-use district with non-residential development near Downsview Subway Station and residential development to the south.

markers.title: Baby Point Heritage Conservation District Study (HCD)
markers.description: Evaluate the Baby Point and Old Millside neighbourhoods located on the eastern banks of the Humber River to determine if designation as a heritage conservation district is warranted, and provide recommendations for any other heritage conservation.

markers.title: Bathurst-Fisherville Block Study
markers.description: The Block Study will address the layout and design of public streets and other pedestrian and cycling connections, parks and open spaces, and built form issues such as building type, location, organization, and massing in the Bathurst-Fisherville area.

markers.title: Bathurst Manor Plaza Development Application
markers.description: Development applications to permit the redevelopment of the Bathurst Manor Plaza at 221-245 Wilmington Avenue, north of Overbrook Place.

markers.title: Bloor West Village Avenue Study
markers.description: Develop a recommended planning framework to guide future development and infrastructure improvements in the study area.

markers.title: Bloor West Village Heritage Conservation District (HCD)
markers.description: Evaluating this neighbourhood through research, a built form survey, analysis and heritage evaluation to determine if the study area warrants designation as a HCD.

markers.title: Cabbagetown Southwest Heritage Conservation District (HCD)
markers.description: Evaluating this neighbourhood to determine if designation as a heritage conservation district is warranted, and provide recommendations for any other heritage conservation measures.

markers.title: Casa Loma Heritage Conservation District (HCD)
markers.description: Evaluating this neighbourhood to determine if designation as a heritage conservation district is warranted, and provide recommendations for any other heritage conservation measures.

markers.title: Changing Lanes
markers.description: How the City allows and regulates laneway suites on the numerous laneways within the Toronto and East York District of the City of Toronto.

markers.title: Christieâ€™s Planning Study
markers.description: Establishing a development framework for a new community at Park Lawn and Lake Shore that focuses on transit, built form, housing, infrastructure and community services and facilities.

markers.title: ConsumersNext
markers.description: A project that will look for ways to enhance the Consumers Road Business Park and areas around the Sheppard Avenue and Victoria Park Avenue intersection.

markers.title: Danforth Avenue Complete Street and Planning Study
markers.description: The City of Toronto is undertaking a Complete Street and Planning Study of Danforth Avenue, one of the most recognizable and major avenues in the City. The full study area will span a six kilometre stretch of Danforth Ave. between Broadview Avenue and Victoria Park Ave.

markers.title: Dufferin Street Secondary Plan
markers.description: Examining the mixed land use and built form potential along Dufferin Street, between Highway 401 to just south of Lawrence Avenue West.

markers.title: Dufferin/Wilson Regeneration Study
markers.description: Developing a vision, in concert with the local community and business owners for the future development in the study area.

markers.title: Don Mills Crossing
markers.description: Examines ways to focus and shape anticipated growth around the intersection of Don Mills Road and Eglinton Avenue East, anchored by transit infrastructure being constructed as part of the Crosstown LRT.

markers.title: Exhibition Place
markers.description: The Exhibition Place Master Plan exercise will study potential improvements to the public realm, open space and mobility networks to and through the Exhibition Place lands, informed by the Cultural Heritage Landscape Assessment completed in 2019.

markers.title: Geary Works Planning Study
markers.description: A study to determine how to best support businesses and creative enterprises on Geary Avenue and improve the public realm.

markers.title: Guidelines for Development Close to Rail Corridors & Yards
markers.description: This Land Use Study will lead to guidelines for a series of rail corridor types.

markers.title: Golden Mile Secondary Plan
markers.description: Develop a vision and comprehensive planning framework in the Golden Mile Secondary Plan Study to facilitate and support appropriate residential and non-residential growth while protecting and encouraging new employment and office development.

markers.title: High Park Apartment Neighbourhood Area Character Study
markers.description: A study of the Apartment Neighbourhood located north of High Park to assess the physical character of the area and develop a policy framework to guide future change and compatible infill development.

markers.title: Inclusionary Zoning Policy
markers.description: Creating policies to require new housing developments to include a certain percentage of affordable housing units.

markers.title: Jane-Finch Initiative
markers.description: A participatory planning exercise for the Jane-Finch area to maximize the benefits of investment in light rail transit, encourage appropriate kinds of development, and advance social equity and economic inclusion for current and future residents.

markers.title: Keele Finch Plus
markers.description: Planning for the future of the area and how to best leverage investment in rapid transit (subway and LRT) for the benefit of the community and city.

markers.title: Kensington Market Heritage Conservation District Plan
markers.description: Evaluating this neighbourhood to determine if designation as a heritage conservation district is warranted, and provide recommendations for any other heritage conservation measures.

markers.title: King-Parliament Secondary Plan Review
markers.description: The review will build on the Downtown Plan, providing specific direction on built form, the public realm and heritage for both the King-Parliament Secondary Plan area and the north side of Queen Street East, between Jarvis and River Streets.

markers.title: King-Spadina Secondary Plan Review
markers.description: The review is about how growth can positively contribute to the liveability of the area, is better supported by hard infrastructure and community infrastructure, and more carefully responds to the strong heritage and character of the area.

markers.title: King Street Transit Priority Corridor
markers.description: This Priority Corridor between Bathurst Street and Jarvis Street aims to improve transit reliability, speed, and capacity by giving priority to streetcars over private vehicles.

markers.title: Laird in Focus
markers.description: Developing a vision and planning framework to guide future development for the Laird Focus area including lands along the west side of Laird Drive.

markers.title: Main Street Planning Study
markers.description: This Study is examining built form and public realm improvements around the area of Main and Danforth to ensure appropriate planning policies are brought forward to guide development and change for this important transit hub and community.

markers.title: Midtown in Focus
markers.description: In response to the intensification and change underway in parts of Midtown Toronto (the Yonge-Eglinton area) City staff want to ensure growth positively contributes to the vitality and livability of one of Torontoâ€™s most dynamic neighbourhoods.

markers.title: Mimico â€“ Judson Regeneration Areas Study
markers.description: A revitalization framework to accommodate employment and residential population growth which capitalizes on the landsâ€™ proximity to Mimico GO Station.

markers.title: Mimico 20/20: A Revitalization Action Plan
markers.description: The secondary plan provides the policy framework for revitalization of this historic Toronto community of Mimico-By-The-Lake.

markers.title: Municipal Shelters
markers.description: Proposing options to increase the as-of-right zoning permissions for municipal shelters.

markers.title: Murray Road Regeneration/Land Use Study
markers.description: Assessing the opportunity for conversion of employment lands through the redesignation of lands to uses that are more compatible with the existing surrounding residential character and the introduction of residential uses.

markers.title: Pet Friendly Design Guidelines for High Density Communities
markers.description: Create Pet Friendly Design Guidelines for Torontoâ€™s multi-unit, high-density communities.

markers.title: Port Lands
markers.description: Update the zoning for employment lands, and increase the as-of-right zoning permissions for port, industrial, and production, interactive and creative uses to be consistent with Port Lands Planning Framework. Also creating urban design guidelines for production, interactive and creative uses.

markers.title: Priority Retail Streets Zoning By-Law
markers.description: A study to update the Priority Retail Streets Zoning By-Law to reflect the retail policy framework in the Downtown Plan.

markers.title: Rail Corridor Site Official Plan Amendment
markers.description: A planning study of the rail corridor to determine how this site can help support growth in the Downtown and contribute to prosperous, liveable and accessible communities.

markers.title: Rail Deck Park
markers.description: Rail Deck Park is a proposal for a new major park in downtown Toronto, to be built over the rail corridor that supports the continued growth, prosperity, and liveability of the city.

markers.title: Roncesvalles and Dundas West Study
markers.description: A planning framework to guide future development along Roncesvalles Avenue, between Queen Street West and Boustead Avenue, and on Dundas Street West, between Boustead Avenue and Sorauren Avenue.

markers.title: Scarborough Centre on the Move
markers.description: Undertaking a transportation master plan to support the vision and evolution of Scarborough Centre as a walkable connected urban centre with an efficient, safe, and balanced transportation network.

markers.title: Scarborough Centre  Review
markers.description: A focused review of the Council approved 2005 Scarborough Centre Secondary Plan to update and further articulate the secondary plan.

markers.title: Secondary Suites
markers.description: Proposing a draft zoning framework to simplify and help facilitate the creation of secondary suites across the city.

markers.title: Sheppard Avenue East Planning Review
markers.description: A focused review of the segment of Sheppard Avenue East (east of Bayview to Leslie Street) to update and further clarify, refine and/or strengthen the density, height and built form policies of the secondary plan for this area.

markers.title: Sherway Area Study
markers.description: The secondary plan for this area updates planning policies and provides a development framework for the Mall and surrounding institutional, office and employment lands that total 200 hectares.

markers.title: St. James Town Connects
markers.description: To create a plan and strategic directions to improve open spaces in the St. James Town neighbourhood by creating more usable, safer and better defined open spaces and pedestrian connections.

markers.title: TOcore
markers.description: TOcore is about how Torontoâ€™s downtown should grow, ensuring that it has the necessary infrastructure to remain a great place to live, work, learn and play.

markers.title: Unilever Precinct / East Harbour Proposed Employment Development
markers.description: Comprehensively consider the transformative vision for a new employment node for approximately 50,000 workers put forward by the commercial developer First Gulf.

markers.title: Visioning Study for Jane & Wilson Area
markers.description: This study for the Jane and Wilson area assesses the land uses, transportation and servicing infrastructure, community services and facilities, built form character, and redevelopment potential of the area.

markers.title: Waterfront Projects
markers.description: Listing of current projects under way in Toronto's waterfront.

markers.title: Waterfront Transit Reset
markers.description: A comprehensive assessment of needs and options for transit improvements for the waterfront area.

markers.title: Weston II Heritage Conservation District Study
markers.description: The Weston II Heritage Conservation District Study area is a residential neighbourhood with a collection of houses in a variety of architectural styles built from the mid-19th through the early 20th centuries located in the former Town of West.

markers.title: West Queen West & Parkdale Main Street HCD Plans
markers.description: Evaluating this neighbourhood to determine if designation as a heritage conservation district is warranted, and provide recommendations for any other heritage conservation measures.

markers.title: Woodside Square Planning Review
markers.description: The planning review will evaluate the appropriateness of permitting additional land uses on the site. The planning review will also establish the policy framework to guide any future redevelopment on the site.

markers.title: Yonge Street North Planning Study
markers.description: A vision for the future of the Yonge Street corridor between Finch Avenue and Steeles Avenue in response to existing and anticipated development pressures in the area.

markers.title: University of Toronto St. George Campus Secondary Plan
markers.description: Official Plan Amendment application to establish a new University of Toronto St. George Campus Secondary Plan that would replace the existing University of Toronto Secondary Plan.

markers.title: Yorkdale Shopping Centre Block Master Plan
markers.description: A development application that involves three conceptual block master plan options for Yorkdale Shopping Centre that include a range of retail, office, hotel and residential uses and an internal private street network to be phased-in over 20+ years.
